gw.api.address

Class CCAddressOwnerUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.address.CCAddressOwnerUtil

  • public class CCAddressOwnerUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities to help CCAddressOwner implementations with address management. It's very tricky to add a new address to the range of available addresses and to also have that address reliably cleaned up if the user does not choose it. This class provides utilities to help. This class is only intended for use within the CCAddressOwner implementation, and may be deprecated and eventually removed in future releases.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrCreateNewBeanFor

        public static <T extends KeyableBean> T getOrCreateNewBeanFor(KeyableBean bean,
                                                              IEntityPropertyInfo property,
                                                              CCAddressOwnerUtil.Creator<T> creator)
        If a new bean already been allocated for the given bean/property pair in the bean's bundle, and the address is still valid (not evicted), then return it. Otherwise create a new address in the bean's bundle using the given creator and return that. At commit time the new bean will be removed unless it is the current value of the given bean/property. All record of new beans is cleared by a successful bundle commit, so a call to this method right after a commit will always create a new bean.

        The type of the given property should match the return type of the provided creator. Unfortunately this cannot

        Parameters:
        bean - a non null keyable bean in an editable bundle
        property - a non null property on the bean that will be used to store the new address, if it is used
        creator - a creator object that can be used to create a new instance of a bean suitable to be stored in the given property on the given bean.
        Returns:
        an address in the bean's bundle

      • wasNewBeanCreatedFor

        public static boolean wasNewBeanCreatedFor(KeyableBean bean,
                                           IEntityPropertyInfo property)
        Has a new bean already been allocated for the given bean/property pair in the bean's bundle? This does not guarantee the any new bean is currently usable, just that one has been created in the bean's bundle since the last successful commit (or since bundle creation if there have been no commits)
        Parameters:
        bean - a non null keyable bean in an editable bundle
        property - a non null property on the bean that can be used to store a new address
        Returns:
        true if getOrCreateNewBeanFor has already been used to create a bean for this bean/property pair in the bean's bundle, false otherwise

      • createNewNonPersistentAddress

        public static Address createNewNonPersistentAddress(Bundle bundle)
        Used by address owner implementations that do not use the range input for selecting multiple addresses and do not really need a "newValue" for the range input at all. Unfortunately we're required to provide a non null new value even if the range input is invisible so this method returns an Address that is marked as non persistent so it will never leak out into the database even if the range input doesn't clean it up.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle in which to create the address
        Returns:
        a new, non persistent, address
